item.title: Creating the image (disk.raw)
item.description: Creating the image (disk.raw) TL;DR: Login to an existing FreeBSD system and run: fetch -qo - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabrik-red/images/master/fabrik.sh | sh or curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabrik-red/images/master/fabrik.sh | sh The fastest way of doing this (less than 1 hour) is to use AWS and chose the c4.8xlarge instance, at the moment of writhing this, is an instance with 36 vCPU / 60 RAM, the important thing to check for, is the amount of cores not really the memory.

item.title: resize ZFS
item.description: The disk.raw automatically on the firstboot will try to resize the disk After booting the ZFS pool need to be increased: $ gpart show da0 Example of output: root@/:~ # gpart show => 40 503316400 da0 GPT (240G) 40 1024 1 freebsd-boot (512K) 1064 2097152 2 freebsd-swap (1.0G) 2098216 984 - free - (492K) 2099200 2093056 3 freebsd-zfs (1.0G) 4192256 499124184 - free - (1.0M) Then type gpart recover da0:
